snippet.title: Sydney dad to remain behind bars after allegedly pointing gun at child, pulling trigger
snippet.content:
A Sydney man will remain behind bars after he and pulled the trigger. The 32-year-old's matter was mentioned at Burwood Local Court on Tuesday after police found footage allegedly showing him pulling the trigger and also allowing the four-year-old girl to play with the weapon.

Phone footage allegedly showed a four-year-old girl playing with an automatic pistol and pulling the trigger without effect.
NSW Police say the gun - a Colt .45 calibre pistol - did not discharge. Officers seized two Colts, a .25 calibre Walther pistol and a Bentley 12-gauge shotgun from properties in Sydney's southwest as part of their investigation, NSW Police previously said in a statement.
"Police also accessed mobile phone video footage which allegedly shows the man skylarking with one of the Colt .45 handguns." The father, who can't be named for legal reasons, did not appear in court on Tuesday and did not apply for bail.
His lawyer, Eidan Havas, outside court asked for "the community to keep an open mind before casting the stone against my client".

The 32-year-old is charged with possessing an unauthorised prohibited firearm, possessing an unauthorised pistol and giving a firearm to a person not authorised by a licence or permit.Photo: NSW Police "Allowing a child to play with a firearm of any kind is reprehensible and is a serious criminal offence," Assistant Commissioner Mark Murdoch said on Monday. The accused man is next scheduled to appear in court on August 16.Photo: NSW Police AAP
